The number of hours of broadcasting has been steadily increased since

Technical Facilities
Ohio University operated a carrier current system which was discon¬
tinued in June 1957* This system served most of the campus but was
unsatisfactory for residential Athens. The transmitter operated on a
carrier frequency of 51*0 kilocycles. Radio frequency energy was carried on
A.C. power lines for purpose of distribution. This system did not produce
enough radiation into space to require a radio station license.
WOUI-FM operates on a carrier frequency of 91*5 megacycles with an
effective radiated power of ID watts. The transmitter designed by Gates
is capable of high fidelity reproduction. The primary coverage extends
to the city limits of Athens.
WCUB operates on a carrier frequency of 131*0 kilocycles at a power of
100 watts. The transmitter is a new Gates 250 watt transmitter. Application
has been filed with FCC to increase the power to 250 watts. This trans¬
mitter is capable.of high fidelity AM broadcasting. WOUB has a primary
coverage of 390 square ijiiles within this area, serving a population of
58,15k people. The secondary coverage is approximately 6 counties or
a 30 mile radius.
